Text_Numeracy: I think my ability to understand basic health information is above average.  I can do research online, and sometimes I have a basic idea of what needs to be done before I even go to the doctor. I nearly always understand what doctors and other health care workers tell me as long as I ask appropriate questions. The only time I don't understand health care information is when I am reading something that is overly technical.
Text_Anxiety: I do believe my doctor is honest, thorough, and careful for the most part. I think sometimes time constrictions can force her to be a little less thorough, especially when it comes to explaining why she is choosing a certain treatment. At times, I have trouble trusting doctors because I don't understand how they know the treatment they have chosen will work.
Text_TrustPhys: I am worried that they will find out I have some horrible disease, or they will give me a medication that causes bad side effects.  I also worry about how much my medical treatments will cost.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I used to be a customer service worker at a gym.  My gym offered equipment orientations to people.  The people who did the equipment orientations were supposed to have training and/or credentials that I did not have.  One night there was an equipment orientation scheduled, and the only person who was supposed to present the information had to deal with another problem.  So I started the orientation and explained how to use the treadmill safely, despite not being "properly" trained.

Text_Numeracy: I feel like I can. And if I don't I ask my doctor or nurse and if I have anything else I search online.
Text_Anxiety: I've had the same primary for nearly my whole adult life. He also has had my parents as patients for many years.
Text_TrustPhys: I'm not usually either of these things. It's the not knowing prior to the doctors that leaves me anxious. Going there I feel relief.
Text_SubjectiveLit: I read a lot to learn. When I was ive enough to trust a doctor who deliberately messed up my knee I had to learn a lot about what he had done and how to fix it.

Text_Numeracy: I have enough ability to understand the basic health services and information given to me and the ability to obtain information about my health conditions. With the internet I'm able to have a full view of what is going on and have the ability to bring up things I've researched to doctors.
Text_Anxiety: I just moved to a new city and have only met with one doctor. She doesn't have the personality to work with me. I'm very educated about my disease and she pretty much brushed me off instead of working with me. I wish doctors would listen to their patients instead of putting them on a 5 minute time clock.
Text_TrustPhys: The lack of compassion. Most doctors don't care about the patient. They just want to push drugs on you and get you out of the door instead of reviewing your background and the things you have tried that was either successful or failed. We have records for a reason and no one seems to read them. I hate having to start from scratch with each doctor I see.
Text_SubjectiveLit: In high school one of my friends said he felt bad. He got up to walk down the hall and passed out. He was sweating and in a sort of daze. Knowing that he had diabetes I grabbed a piece of candy out of my purse and shoved it in his mouth. This perked him up enough to help him get to the nurses station and get his sugar levels sorted out. It had dropped insanely low.

Text_Numeracy: Some ability. I get help from my mom most of the time with things. Without my mom helping me I would be stuck.
Text_Anxiety: I trust my doctor and all doctors cause they go to school for a long long time and are very friendly and know it all when it comes to my health.
Text_TrustPhys: I don't like the waiting room and the waiting and I can sometimes be afraid of what procedures I might need done and to talk to him about it.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When I look up things online I get a lot of know it all. I like to look things up online a lot to know thing about health.

Text_Numeracy: I feel like I am capable of understanding and communicating with health professionals about my healthcare.  I also feel confident about making appropriate health decisions for myself.
Text_Anxiety: I pretty much trust my primary care doctor. She is friendly and easy to talk to. Sometimes I do feel like she is a little preoccupied with other things and in a hurry. But over all I think I receive adequate care from her.
Text_TrustPhys: I feel a little anxious when I go to the doctor because I know she is going to tell me that for my health I need to eat better and exercise.  I don't do those things and I know she will get on to me about it.
Text_SubjectiveLit: My neighbor got stung by a wasp last year.  He was stung on the neck.  The sting was very red and swelling fast.  I took him to the emergency room.  He found out he was allergic and it waas a good thing I took him on to the emergency room.

Text_Numeracy: I have the capacity to understand and process health information because it's normally printed in standard English. Not to sound pretentious, but I am educated so it's not terribly difficult to read and comprehend medical information.
Text_Anxiety: I don't necessarily trust physician's opinions a hundred percent of the time because they can be wrong like anyone else. One physician is just one person's opinion.
Text_TrustPhys: Well, no one wants to die and sometimes we have to face that when visiting the doctor's office. If something is wrong, then you have to start thinking.
Text_SubjectiveLit: Actually going to the doctor's office and health science classes in schooling. Even though, I will admit that the majority of these questions were math related.

Text_Numeracy: I feel like I'm able to find needed information. I often look things up on the internet if I have questions. Also, if I have major questions, I ask them during my scheduled check ups.
Text_Anxiety: I've gone to the same doctors for years, since I was a child. She's kind and seems knowledgeable. She always answers all of my questions.
Text_TrustPhys: Having questions that won't get answered, but they usually always are answered well. Also, I always worry about my weight, as to whether I've gained any.
Text_SubjectiveLit: No experiences really stick out. I've taken first aid and CPR training so those have given me some knowledge about various health and medical issues.

Text_Numeracy: Plenty and what i don't know i would ask the appropriate people to help me out with it. Doctor, nurse etc. I feel confident though that i could do it on my own as i already have access to my health information through my drs. portal.
Text_Anxiety: I trust my dr because he is always up front and honest with me and tells me all. He always listens to my concerns and is always listening and helping me out. He is a caring dr. Not one that just gets you in and out to make money.
Text_TrustPhys: Not knowing what the outcome of what i am there for. Telling me things that i am probably not going to want to hear. Being told i am doing something wrong. I feel anxious not knowing the results of tests i have had taken. Prescribing pills that have side effects is nerve wracking.
Text_SubjectiveLit: When my husband died and i had to give him cpr. Which i did till medics got there then they took over. Unfortunately he did'tn make it. I was thankful that i had learned cpr in my younger days and was able to  hellp.
